qas.question: What is one of the names the Greeks call their country?
What is the official name of Greece?
From what word is Greece derived?
What does the work Graecia mean?

context: The names for the nation of Greece and the Greek people differ from the names used in other languages, locations and cultures. Although the Greeks call the country <a0_0>Hellas<a0_0/> or Ellada (Greek: Ἑλλάς or Ελλάδα) and its official name is the <a1_0>Hellenic Republic<a1_0/>, in English it is referred to as Greece, which comes from the Latin term <a2_0>Graecia<a2_0/> as used by the <a4_0>Romans<a4_0/>, which literally means '<a3_0>the land of the Greeks<a3_0/>', and derives from the Greek name Γραικός. However, the name Hellas is sometimes used in English as well.
